did.abstract: Betty van der Smissen was an alumna of the University of Kansas and Indiana University and an educator, writer, and consultant in the field of outdoor recreation and risk management. Contents of this collection date from 1954 through 2008 and consist mainly of teaching material such as course syllabi, correspondence, readings, and exams; research and drafts of publications; handbooks and self-assesment material for park and recreation agency accreditations; and material related to van der Smissen's participation in professional organizations and conferences.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Margaret "Betty" van der Smissen was born on December 27, 1927, in Great Bend, Kansas. After high school she entered the University of Kansas, where she earned her BA in 1949 and J.D. in 1952. She continued her studies at Indiana University, where she earned a Master's in Recreation in 1954 and and Doctor of Recreation (Re.D.) in 1955.

With her legal background, Dr. van der Smissen went on to become one of the most sought-after experts in the area of sport and recreation negligence. She authored accreditation standards for recreation university curricula, parks and recreation agencies, and the American Camping Association camps. She spent her professional career as faculty at a number of universities and colleges, including Iowa University, Penn State, Michigan State University, Bowling Green University, and the University of Northern Iowa. During this time, Dr. van der Smissen gave more than 500 presentations and lectures worldwide, authored or co-authored numerous textbooks, chapters, professional articles and educational films and videos.
Dr. van der Smissen passed away in November 2008.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The contents of this collection are in the order in which they were received.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection documents Betty van der Smissen's career as an educator, writer, and consultant in the field of outdoor recreation and risk management. Contents date from 1954 through 2008 and consist mainly of teaching material such as course syllabi, correspondence, readings, and exams; research and drafts of publications; handbooks and self-assesment material for park and recreation agency accreditations; and material related to van der Smissen's participation in professional organizations and conferences.
